rows.CUSTOMER ARCHETYPE PROFILES: 5-7 detailed personas with names, photos, full backstories
ARCHETYPE 1: KETO KEVIN
Demographics: Male, 35-45, $100K+ income, suburban
Diet: Strict keto 2+ years, tracks macros religiously
Lifestyle: Desk job, works out 4x/week, biohacker curious
Pain points:
• Keto flu when starting, electrolyte crashes
• Current solution (LMNT) works but expensive
• Wants 'cleaner' more 'natural' option
• Wife thinks he spends too much on supplements
Triggers: Podcast ad, keto influencer recommendation, Reddit thread
Objections: 'I already have LMNT', 'Is this actually different?'
Decision drivers: Science, ingredients, trusted endorsement
Quote: 'I've optimized everything else, why wouldn't I optimize my electrolytes?'
ARCHETYPE 2: CROSSFIT CLAIRE
Demographics: Female, 28-38, active lifestyle, urban/suburban
Diet: Paleo-ish, not strict but avoids processed food
Lifestyle: CrossFit 5x/week, runs on weekends, competitive
Pain points:
• Cramps during WODs
• Hates sugary sports drinks
• Needs something that travels to gym
• Wants clean label she can Instagram
Triggers: Gym buddy recommendation, sees it in someone's bag
Objections: 'Is it worth the price?', 'Will it taste salty?'
Decision drivers: Taste, convenience, clean label, community proof
Quote: 'I put so much effort into my workout, why would I drink garbage after?'
ARCHETYPE 3: BIOHACKER BEN
Demographics: Male, 30-50, tech/finance, high income, urban
Diet: Experiments constantly (carnivore, fasting, etc.)
Lifestyle: Optimizes everything, tracks with Oura/Whoop, cold plunge
Pain points:
• Wants the BEST, not just good enough
• Frustrated by 'incomplete' synthetic electrolytes
• Researches obsessively before buying
• Willing to pay premium for premium
Triggers: Huberman/Attia mention, deep Reddit thread, PubMed rabbit hole
Objections: 'Where's the data?', 'Who's behind this?'
Decision drivers: Science, sourcing transparency, uniqueness
Quote: 'If it doesn't have published research, I'm not interested.'
ARCHETYPE 4: FASTING FIONA
Demographics: Female, 35-55, health-conscious, any income level
Diet: Intermittent fasting (16:8 or longer), some keto overlap
Lifestyle: Busy professional or mom, health is priority but time is scarce
Pain points:
• Feels terrible during fasting window (headaches, fatigue)
• Worried about 'breaking fast' with electrolytes
• Doesn't want sugar or artificial sweeteners
• Needs something simple that works
Triggers: Fasting group recommendation, sees someone else using it
Objections: 'Will this break my fast?', 'I don't want to feel bloated'
Decision drivers: Zero calorie, clean ingredients, fasting-approved
Quote: 'I just want to feel good during my fast without overthinking it.'
ARCHETYPE 5: WEEKEND WARRIOR WILL
Demographics: Male, 30-45, moderate income, suburban
Diet: Tries to eat healthy, not strict about anything
Lifestyle: Plays sports on weekends, occasional gym, active but not obsessed
Pain points:
• Gets cramps/dehydrated after weekend activities
• Doesn't want to drink Gatorade (too much sugar)
• Not a 'supplement guy' but knows he needs something
• Wants simple, not complicated
Triggers: Cramp episode, friend recommendation, simple ad
Objections: 'Do I really need this?', 'Isn't water enough?'
Decision drivers: Simplicity, price, 'it just works'
Quote: 'I don't want to become a supplement bro, I just want to not cramp.'
